skill.name: changelog
skill.description: Maintains IdeaVim changelog (CHANGES.md) and build.gradle.kts changeNotes. Use when updating changelog, documenting releases, or reviewing commits/PRs for changelog entries.
skill.summary: Maintains IdeaVim changelog (CHANGES.md) and build.gradle.kts changeNotes. Use when updating changel...
skill.author: JetBrains

security_audit.summary: The skill contains guidance text only and no executable code. No file access, network calls, or command execution are implemented in this directory.

content.value_statement: You need accurate IdeaVim release notes without manual formatting. This skill provides rules and formats to keep CHANGES.md and changeNotes aligned.
actual_capabilities: Define the [To Be Released] workflow and version section structure
Specify formatting for Features, Fixes, Changes, and Merged PRs
Enforce link formats for YouTrack tickets and GitHub PRs
Apply exclusion rules for internal, test-only, and bot changes
Convert CHANGES.md items to HTML for build.gradle.kts changeNotes
limitations: Only supports the IdeaVim changelog conventions described in the skill
Requires repository history access to identify real changes
Does not run tests or validate build outputs
Does not generate release notes outside CHANGES.md and changeNotes

use_cases.title: Prepare a release section
use_cases.description: Draft the next version entry, move items out of [To Be Released], and create a new empty section.

use_cases.title: Sync Marketplace notes
use_cases.description: Convert the [To Be Released] content into HTML changeNotes for the JetBrains Marketplace listing.

use_cases.title: Review changes for notes
use_cases.description: Decide which merged PRs and fixes should appear in the changelog sections.

prompt_templates.title: Add a fix entry
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner update to a small change
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a Fixes entry for VIM-1234 that says ci" works in empty strings, under [To Be Released] with correct link format.

prompt_templates.title: Draft a release
prompt_templates.scenario: New version is ready for notes
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a 2.28.0 section dated 2024-09-15 and move current [To Be Released] items into it.

prompt_templates.title: Sync changeNotes
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert the current [To Be Released] section into build.gradle.kts changeNotes HTML with links and code tags.

prompt_templates.title: Audit recent PRs
prompt_templates.prompt: Review recent PRs since the last tag and list entries to add, excluding dependabot, internal refactors, and api module changes.

output_examples.input: Summarize fixes to add under [To Be Released].
output: Fixes: VIM-3456 Fixed cursor position after undo in visual mode
Fixes: VIM-3458 Fixed ci" command in empty strings
Changes: Note the changelog gap for versions 2.10.0 through 2.27.0

best_practices: Use exact command examples from tests or code for fix descriptions
Keep each change in only one section to avoid duplication
Preserve the changelog gap note between 2.9.0 and 2.28.0
anti_patterns: Logging internal refactors that users cannot observe
Rewriting PR titles in the Merged PRs section
Summarizing changeNotes instead of matching CHANGES.md

faq.question: Is this compatible with other projects?
faq.answer: No. It is tailored to the IdeaVim changelog and changeNotes format.

faq.question: What are the limits on entries?
faq.answer: Entries should be concise and only include user visible changes or notable PRs.

faq.question: Can it integrate with GitHub workflows?
faq.answer: Yes. It references git and gh commands for workflow based updates.

faq.question: Does it access sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. The skill content is guidance only and does not access files or credentials.

faq.question: What if information is missing or unclear?
faq.answer: Omit the entry rather than adding vague or unverifiable text.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic changelog tools?
faq.answer: It enforces IdeaVim specific sections, link formats, and exclusion rules.
